Class MyPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.fr.ut2j.m1ice.ootesting.MyPoint

  • public class MyPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    A Basic point with double values.

      Constructor 3 Creates a point from a IMyPoint

        public MyPoint()
        Constructor 1 Creates a MyPoint with coordinates (0, 0).

      • MyPoint

        public MyPoint(double x,
               double y)
        Constructor 2 Creates a MyPoint with the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-coordinate to set.
        y - The Y-coordinate to set.

      • MyPoint

        public MyPoint(MyPoint pt)
        Constructor 3 Creates a point from a IMyPoint. (0,0) will be used when the given pt is null.
        Parameters:
        pt - The IMyPoint, if null the default value (0,0) will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • setX

        public void setX(double newX)
        Sets the X coordinate of the point.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new X coordinate. Must be valid (not equal Double.NaN), otherwise nothing is done.

      • setY

        public void setY(double newY)
        Sets the Y coordinate of the point.
        Parameters:
        newY - The new Y coordinate. Must be valid (not equal Double.NaN), otherwise nothing is done.

        Returns:
        The X coordinate of the point.

        Returns:
        The Y coordinate of the point.

      • scale

        public MyPoint scale(double sx)
        Creates a new point scaled using the scaling factor.
        Parameters:
        sx - The scaling factor.
        Returns:
        The scaled point.
        Since:
        3.0

      • horizontalSymmetry

        public MyPoint horizontalSymmetry(MyPoint origin)
        Returns horizontally the point.
        Parameters:
        origin - The location of the horizontal axe.
        Returns:
        the computed point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the given parameter is null.

      • computeAngle

        public double computeAngle(MyPoint pt)
        Computes the angle of the given point where the calling point is used as the gravity centre.
        Parameters:
        pt - The point used to compute the angle.
        Returns:
        The angle or NaN if the given point null.

      • rotatePoint

        public MyPoint rotatePoint(MyPoint gravityC,
                           double theta)
        Rotates a point with as reference another point.
        Parameters:
        gravityC - The point of reference.
        theta - The angle of rotation in radian.
        Returns:
        The rotated point.
        Since:
        1.9

      • centralSymmetry

        public MyPoint centralSymmetry(MyPoint centre)
        Gets a point by central symmetry.
        Parameters:
        centre - The centre of the symmetry.
        Returns:
        The resulting point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the given parameter is null.

      • getMiddlePoint

        public MyPoint getMiddlePoint(MyPoint p)
        Parameters:
        p - The second point.
        Returns:
        The middle point of the current and given points.

      • translate

        public void translate(double tx,
                      double ty)
        Translates the point. If one of the given coordinate is not valid (Double.NaN), the translation does not occur.
        Parameters:
        tx - The X translation.
        ty - The Y translation.

      • setPoint

        public void setPoint(java.util.Random random1,
                     java.util.Random random2)
        Sets a point using random values provided by random.newInt().
        Parameters:
        random1 - The random number generator used for x.
        random2 - The random number generator used for y.

      • translate

        public void translate(main.fr.ut2j.m1ice.ootesting.ITranslation translation)
        Translates the point using a given vector.
        Parameters:
        translation - The translation vector. If null, nothing is performed.
